name: Edgewater Inn & Suites

reviews.title: They stole my credit card number
reviews.text: The first time we stayed there, we needed a handicapped room to accommodate a wheelchair. That visit was okay.The second time we stayed there, staff member(s) either used or sold my credit card number to people who subsequently charged thousands of dollars in airline tickets on my card.It's too bad that an adequate motel such as this has dishonest people working for them. Needless to say, we will NOT stay there again and will make sure family and friends don't, either.

reviews.title: Clean and Comfortable
reviews.text: Stayed overnight on way to San Francisco. Large motel, but very few rooms occupied at the time. Very close to the beach. Nice and clean and comfortable, and spacious. Continental breakfast consisted of a muffin and a coffee, but whose complaining at US$70 a night for 2 adults and a child.

My husband and I stayed here for a night on the way up to San Fran. We went off season in September and paid £41 for a double room. At that price we couldn't really complain. Location is great, right on the beach front. Other reviewers are correct in saying that it looks like it's had better days and was quite tatty round the edges. The staff were very pleasant though and the room was clean with a working fridge. I don't know what they charge on peak season but for somewhere that cheap, we really couldn't complain. Pismo beach off season is a really great place to visit by the way.
reviews.title: Not bad
Horrible Experience!!!
reviews.text: Upon arriving to the Edgewater we were happy with the location. We spoke with a hotel clerk to see if we could park our vehicle in the parking lot and enjoy our day at the beach before checking in. We arrived at 11am and check in is at 3pm. The said no problem and it looked as if every person who was not staying at the hotel was doing the same thing. Taking up parking for guests.

Anyhow, we spent the day at the beach. We have 2 small children (age 4 1/2 & 2 1/2) so the flight of steps leading down was much better than the Tiki resorts down the way. The beach has a public restroom however there is not a lifegaurd station in front of the hotel. There are 2 that are located on either side of location about 1/2 mile down the beach. So do keep your eyes open.
reviews.title: Fine for us
Not What It Used To Be!
reviews.text: Checking in at 3pm was very simple. We stayed on the beach for a few more hours before packing it up and heading back to our room. 331. It is the last room on the 3 rd level that you can still see somewhat of an "ocean view". Ridiculous!!! You have a better view of the pool then you do the ocean. So, don't bother if you are really wanting a view. The room was also located next to the vending machines, elevator and of all things a "Courtesy Smoking Station". OUTRAGEOUS!! The 2nd floor rooms are all smoking rooms, put the "Courtesy Stations" on that floor. The icing on our cake was at 6:30 am we were woken up to the sounds of stomping. It sounded like a group of people were doing jump and jacks above us. Low and Behold we found out that it was the "Continental Breakfast" being served above us in the Sky Room. DIRECTLY ABOVE US! Also, our room did not have a working a/c or fan. It was horrible at night. Especially after spending a day at the beach. My two kids were sweating all night so I finally opened up the bathroom window and prayed that we would be safe.

reviews.title: Not great
reviews.text: This hotel was in a good location for the beach, but was very noisy with lots families staying there. Rooms were rather tatty, our bathroom had a bit of mould on the wall and the tap kept dripping. A bit over priced.

reviews.title: Visit every Year
reviews.text: My Family and I Have stayed her every year. EVERY year we come and visit and we love it. It it not big and fancy, but it is a very cute motel. The kids love the pool and it is ight on the beach!! They do have some rooms that are ocean view Usually we get them when we request but around the holidays u want to request them ahead of time!!! I have had a good experience every time and I will keep comming

reviews.title: Neutral
reviews.text: This was a basic hotel that is in a good location but could use some updating. The desk staff were very pleasant.

reviews.title: Fun at the beach
reviews.text: Great place for family vacation. Comfortable room, able to walk to everything we wanted to do. We did drive to Oceano for the Melodrama...everyone enjoy the show. Looking forward to a return trip.

reviews.title: Fine basic room
reviews.text: This is a fine, basic room and centrally located - only. We stayed there for 3 nights - but didn't spend any time in or around the room during the day. So, for our needs, it was fine. If I wanted to nicer vacation where I would hang around the room more often and in comfort, I would not stay here again. Our room could have used a little more scrubbing in the bathroom and a good steam cleaning of the carpets. We could hear every single word of every person walking by or down the stair case. But, all in all, it's a fine place if all you need is the basics and you're on a budget.

description: Just a staircase away from the sand and a short two block walk from downtown, you’ll find the beautiful Edgewater Inn and Suites. This Pismo Beach hotel offers a heated pool and spa, complementary high speed (wireless) internet service, and a variety of room options ranging from single king beds to full kitchen suites with views of the ocean. In the mornings you’ll enjoy fresh baked muffins, fruit, orange juice, coffee, and tea. You’ll also enjoy the yummy fresh baked cookies in the afternoon. This landmark hotel also offers pet friendly rooms (with no additional fee), free parking, and 24 hour a day front desk staff for your assistance.
